alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 1:44PM PDT until August 24 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern San Diego County in southwestern California... * Until 445 PM PDT. * At 144 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... I-8 near Live Oak Springs and Boulevard, State Highway 94, Boulevard, Campo, Lake Morena, Campo Indian Reservation, Live Oak Springs, La Posta Indian Reservation, Manzanita Indian Reservation and Tierra Del Sol. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
